thread.title: NJSIAA: 'Redshirt' bill introduced in state Senate - NJSIAA News
thread.title_full: NJSIAA: 'Redshirt' bill introduced in state Senate - NJSIAA News - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: NJSIAA: 'Redshirt' bill introduced in state Senate - NJSIAA News
text:
A bill has been introduced in the state Senate to limit athletes who "redshirt" in middle school to only three years or six consecutive semesters of high school athletic eligibility.
The bill – S3221 – seeks to deter athletes from repeating sixth, seventh or eighth grades despite being in good academic standing to reap an athletic advantage. It was sponsored Monday by state Sen. Richard Codey (D-Essex) and co-sponsored by state Sen. Peter Barnes (D-Middlesex).
Last week, the New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association expressed concern that it could not enforce the bill if passed. The proposed legislation calls for the NJSIAA to regulate the process.
– Staff report
